text: I think it's high time I shared with you
guys a pretty classic version of Caesar
salad I've made other Caesars before but
this one's just a little closer to the
original with the anchovy with egg yolk
and the dressing I think it's really
delicious and I think you guys will too
this recipe serves to but you could
easily increase it to serve more people
if you'd like I'm cutting two slices of
one inch thick rustic bread into 1-inch
cubes I'm my oven preheating to 400
degrees dressing your bread cubes with
olive oil and then season with some salt
give the toss and then these need to go
into the oven until they're golden brown
you can stir them once or twice that
should take about 10-12 minutes I have a
delicious block of Parmesan cheese now
is not the time to skimp on your cheese
for the dressing what you're going to
want to do is take a garlic clove and a
couple of anchovy fillets and a half a
teaspoon of salt put them on the board
together and then mash everything
together the salt will work as an
abrasive and make it easier to mash
everything into a paste you can start
off by chopping a little bit in classic
Caesar salad this is usually done in a
mortar and pestle but that's not
something that a lot of people have on
hand so this works really well as a
substitute for that I have a special
garlic and onion board that I use at
home and I don't cut fruit or other
things on it because even though I wash
everything the flavor sort of permeates
you're looking for your anchovies and
your garlic to be a really fine paste
this way you won't be getting chunks of
either of those things in your dressing
you'll just be getting the great flavor
I'm adding a tiny bit more salt because
I think that my garlic clove was kind of
big needs a little bit more salt to get

transfer it to a bowl to make your

is going to make the dressing really

people

and then you can whisk in your oil use

qualities about three tablespoons oh
